page.title: 05Continental Ferry Port
page.content: With Portsmouth's superb situation, having easy sea-ward access to Europe, it would appear obvious to have a ferry port. Its potential, however, was not realised until 1976, when, after the completion of the{M275,}a direct and fast route off the island, {Brittany Ferries}established a terminal. As business flourished, they were joined by{Townsend Thoresen}and the recently privatized{Sealink. { 235,000 vehicles and 970,000 {passengers}per year are carried over the English Channel. Sealink sail to {Cherbourg, Jersey}and{Guernsey, Townsend Thoresen to{Le Havre}and {Cherbourg,}and Brittany Ferries to{St {Malo.}Aboard many of the ships are bars, video games, observation decks, lounges and cinemas, as well as banks, gift shops and restaurants. -Rupert Gauntlett PGS.
